As many as half of the stars in the universe may be outside galaxies, according to a new study. These previously unknown stars were likely ejected from their home galaxies during galaxy collisions.

TIL Before the widespread use of artificial light, most people didn't sleep in a single block. Instead, they likely went to bed shortly after dusk, slept for four or five hours, awakened for an hour or two, then would go back to sleep until sunrise.

TIL humans usually get the urge to pee when the bladder is just 1/3 full. But in zero gravity, the urge doesn't kick in till the bladder is almost completely full. When John Glenn orbited the Earth, his only urination was 27 ounces, seven ounces more than the capacity of the avg human bladder.
